item.title: Linux
item.description: HOWTO create and run a linux developer virtual machine on your non-linux laptop. Install VMware Workstation Player for Windows 64-bit Operating Systems Download Ubuntu Desktop iso Open VMware Workstation Player and create a new Virtual Machine In the dialogue, choose “I will install the operating system later”: Choose “Linux” Version Ubuntu 64-bit Give it a suitable name and Location should be on your computer, preferably a SSD.

item.title: Required software
item.description: In your linux machine you will need to install some software Docker Instructions here Docker compose Instructions here Maven % sudo apt-get install maven OpenJDK % sudo apt-get install default-jdk This is as of now openjdk-11. If you need java 8, do % sudo apt-get install openjdk-8-jdk Kotlin % snap install kotlin Git % sudo apt-get install git Python Python (both 2.7 and 3.) should be preinstalled.

item.title: Recommended software
item.description: The following is a list of useful software that is recommended An IDE ATOM % sudo snap install atom --classic or IntelliJ IDEA Community Edition % sudo snap install intellij-idea-community --classic --edge For Python-hackers, it is highly recommended to install and use virtual-env sudo apt-get install python3-venv Google Cloud SDK sudo snap install google-cloud-sdk --classic You then have to initialize the SDK. Follow instructions here
